intro: Nigella degenii subsp. minor, commonly known as the lesser cumin, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the Ranunculaceae family and is characterized by its slender, branched stems and small, yellowish flowers. The plant produces small, spherical seeds that are often used in traditional medicine and as a spice. It thrives in well-drained soils and requires a cool climate for optimal growth. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endangered species in its native habitat.
